definition: New Dramatic Society, Chinese theatrical company from 1912, a continuation of Tokyo Spring Willow Society 春柳社[Chun1 liu3 she4]

sentences.english: He was a strongly committed comrade of the Party.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個對黨非常忠誠的同志。

sentences.english: Comrades! What is a true bastion of iron?
sentences.chinese: 同志們，真正的銅牆鐵壁是什麼？

sentences.english: Li Chunlin was removed from the post of Director-General of the Price Control Administration of Jiangsu Province.
sentences.chinese: 免去李春林同志的江蘇省物價局副局長職務。

sentences.english: Workshop director of high-strength comrades wholeheartedly welcome customers to negotiate business.
sentences.chinese: 車間主任高強同志竭誠歡迎廣大客戶前來洽談業務。

sentences.english: But we must remind our comrades that they must truly follow the spirit of the "May 7th Directive".
sentences.chinese: 但要提醒同志們注意，必須真正執行五七指示的精神。

sentences.english: The task is in the charge of Comrade Li.
sentences.chinese: 這項工作由李同志負責。

sentences.english: All comrades in the Party, no matter what posts they are in.
sentences.chinese: 全黨同志無論在什麼崗位上。

sentences.english: In his speech, he compared the plight of gays to that of blacks during the civil-rights era.
sentences.chinese: 他在演講中將同志的境遇比作民權運動時期的黑人。

sentences.english: He dropped in on some old comrades on his vacation trip to Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 他在去北京度假時順便訪問一些老同志。

sentences.english: Comrade Li Zhu shot dead on the spot.
sentences.chinese: 李竹同志當場擊斃死亡。

sentences.english: Comrade Yang delivered the opening speech.
Eg. The Korean people set up a monument in memory of Comrade Luo Shengjiao.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮人民立了一個紀念碑紀念羅盛教同志。

sentences.english: None of us, including the veteran comrades, is sufficiently capable of directing modern wars.
sentences.chinese: 指揮現代化戰爭，包括我們老同志在內，能力都不夠。

sentences.english: However, some of my comrades did eat herring, and it was a disaster.
sentences.chinese: 然而，我的一些同志還是吃了，而這鯡魚的確惡毒。

sentences.english: Sir, in others' eye you are the greatest nuisance. You should not irritate them once more.
sentences.chinese: 同志，你最討人厭了，別再激怒其他人了啊。

definition: secretary (chief official of a branch of a socialist or communist party)/clerk/scribe
